entry.title: masonjoany (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that women in Madagascar paint their faces with masonjoany (example pictured) as a form of decorative sun protection?

entry.title: Margaret C. Roberts (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Margaret C. Roberts was encouraged to study medicine by LDS Church leader Brigham Young to reduce mortality rates during childbirth?

entry.title: intrapersonal communication (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that some theorists claim that intrapersonal communication is the basis of all communication?

entry.title: Desmond Watson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at over 400 pounds (180 kg), Desmond Watson is one of the largest players in NCAA Division I football history?

entry.title: Infinity Stones (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Infinity Stones were not planned to be the MacGuffins of the Marvel Cinematic Universe's Infinity Saga until at least 2012?

entry.title: Bonnie Elliott (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Bonnie Elliott devised the concept for a campaign to promote female representation in cinematography?

entry.title: Running Out of Time (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Paramore song "Running Out of Time" is based on singer Hayley Williams's friendship with Taylor Swift?

entry.title: Eriko Sotarduga (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that as part of his 2014 reelection campaign, Indonesian legislator Eriko Sotarduga provided free haircuts and motorcycle repairs?
